desc: TCEB1 encodes a protein that is a component of the VHL ubiquitination complex. A hotspot mutation of TCEB1 is associated with a distinct subtype of renal cell carcinoma.

The TCEB1 (transcription elongation factor B polypeptide 1) gene encodes the elongin C protein, a subunit of the transcription factor B protein complex which activates RNA elongation during transcription (PMID: 7660129). TCEB1 is also part of the elongin BC complex, which functions as an E3 ubiquitin ligase and includes the Von-Hippel Landau (VHL) tumor suppressor, TCEB2 (elongin B), CUL2 or CUL5 and RBX1 (PMID: 25298778). Under normoxic conditions, this complex targets the hypoxia inducible factor, HIF1A, for ubiquitination and degradation, thus preventing a hypoxic response (PMID: 23797736). However, dysregulation of this complex, including inactivation of VHL or TCEB1, can lead to HIF1A accumulation and a pseudohypoxic response, even under normoxic conditions (PMID: 25298778). TCEB1-mutated renal carcinomas are molecularly distinct from conventional clear cell renal cell carcinomas, and lack both VHL mutations and chromosome 3p loss (PMID: 25676555, 23797736).

articles.title: TCEB1-mutated renal cell carcinoma: a distinct genomic and morphological subtype.
